text: Which term represents the ability to increase the computing capacity of a virtual machine by adding memory or CPUs?
explanation: Vertical scaling (scaling up) involves adding more resources like CPU or memory to an existing virtual machine.

text: What enables a cloud service to adapt quickly to changing requirements?
explanation: Agility in cloud computing refers to the ability to rapidly develop, test, and deploy applications and adapt to changing business requirements quickly.

text: What additional resource is required by an Azure virtual machine?
explanation: Every Azure virtual machine requires a virtual network.

text: How many copies of data are maintained by an Azure Storage account that uses locally-redundant storage (LRS)?
explanation: Locally-redundant storage (LRS) maintains three copies of your data within a single datacenter.

text: You have an Azure subscription and 100 Windows 10 devices. You need to ensure that only users whose devices have the latest security patches installed can access Azure AD-integrated applications. What should you implement?
explanation: Conditional access policies in Azure AD can enforce compliance requirements before granting access.

text: You have on-premises servers that run Windows Server. What should you implement to manage the servers by using the Azure portal?
explanation: Azure Arc extends Azure management capabilities to on-premises environments.

text: You plan to deploy a service to Azure virtual machines. You need to ensure that the service will be available if a datacenter fails. What should you use as part of the virtual machine deployment?
explanation: Availability zones protect against datacenter-level failures.

text: At which OSI layer does ExpressRoute operate?
explanation: Azure ExpressRoute operates at Layer 2 (Data Link Layer) of the OSI model.

text: What is a feature of an Azure virtual network?
explanation: Azure virtual networks provide isolation and segmentation capabilities.

text: What provides a unified way to project and manage non-Azure resources in Azure Resource Manager (ARM)?
explanation: Azure Arc projects non-Azure resources into ARM for unified management.

text: In the software as a service (SaaS) cloud service, which responsibility is shared between Microsoft and the customer?
explanation: In SaaS, information and data management is a shared responsibility.

text: Your company has an Azure subscription and three business units. You need to ensure that the new resources are deployed by using a repeatable and reliable method. What should you use?
explanation: ARM templates provide infrastructure as code for consistent deployments.

text: You plan to reduce ongoing Azure expenditures. Which three factors affect the costs of a resource?
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.
explanation: Azure costs are affected by data type processed, outbound data volume, and service tier.

text: Which cloud computing benefit provides continuous user access to a cloud-based application with minimal downtime?
explanation: High availability ensures applications remain accessible with minimal downtime.

text: What should a desktop application use to interact with Azure and manage resources?
explanation: Desktop applications use Azure REST APIs to programmatically interact with Azure.

text: Which Azure service is an example of serverless computing?
explanation: Azure Functions is a serverless compute service that runs event-triggered code without managing infrastructure.

text: You need to migrate an on-premises server by using a lift-and-shift migration. To which type of cloud service should you migrate?
explanation: Lift-and-shift migrations are best suited for IaaS as it provides virtual machines that can host applications with minimal changes.

text: Which two features or services can be integrated with Azure Monitor? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
note: Each correct answer is worth one point.
explanation: Application Insights and Log Analytics are both integrated features of Azure Monitor.

text: You have a set of Azure policies. You need to group related policies together. What should you use?
explanation: Azure Policy initiatives allow you to group multiple related policy definitions together.

text: What can you use to make recommendations that will reduce Azure costs?
explanation: Azure Advisor provides personalized recommendations including cost optimization.

text: Microsoft 365 is an example of which cloud service model?
explanation: Microsoft 365 is a SaaS offering providing ready-to-use applications.

text: What is the function of a Site-to-Site VPN?

options.label: A
options.text: provides a secure connection between a computer on a public network and the corporate network

options.label: B
options.text: provides a connection from an on-premises VPN device to an Azure VPN gateway

options.label: C
options.text: provides a dedicated private connection to Azure that does NOT travel over the internet

explanation: A Site-to-Site VPN connects on-premises VPN devices to Azure VPN gateway.

text: What should you use to track the costs of Azure resources?
explanation: Azure budgets help track and manage costs of Azure resources.

text: You plan to collect and analyze event details for five Azure virtual machines. Which two tools should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.
explanation: Azure Monitor and Log Analytics work together to collect, analyze, and query event data from VMs.

text: You need to compare a company's cloud usage to industry standard best practices. What should you use?
explanation: Azure Advisor provides best practice recommendations based on industry standards.

text: Your company has an Azure subscription that contains several resources. You need to identify which department is responsible for the cost of each resource. What should you use?
explanation: Tags can be used to organize resources and track costs by department or other categories.

text: Which service can replace a resource lock automatically if the lock is removed?
explanation: Azure Blueprints can automatically reapply resource locks if they are removed, ensuring governance policies remain enforced.

text: What is used to grant permission to Azure Virtual Desktop resources?
explanation: RBAC roles are used to grant permissions to Azure Virtual Desktop resources.

text: You have an Azure subscription. You need to review your secure score. What should you use?
explanation: Microsoft Defender for Cloud (formerly Azure Security Center) provides the secure score feature.

text: What is an example of vertical scaling in a cloud environment?

options.label: A
options.text: additional CPU to an existing Azure virtual machine

options.label: B
options.text: adding an additional Azure App Service instance automatically

options.label: C
options.text: adding an additional Azure virtual machine

options.label: D
options.text: adding an additional Azure Virtual Desktop session host

explanation: Vertical scaling (scaling up) means adding more resources like CPU or memory to an existing instance.

text: What enables a cloud service to adapt quickly to changing requirements?
explanation: Agility is the ability to rapidly deploy and configure cloud resources as requirements change.

text: What additional resource is required by an Azure virtual machine?
explanation: A virtual network is required for every Azure virtual machine deployment.

text: How many copies of data are maintained by an Azure Storage account that uses locally-redundant storage (LRS)?
explanation: LRS maintains three synchronous copies of data within a single datacenter.

text: You have an Azure subscription. You plan to create a virtual machine. Where will the virtual machine be placed in Azure?
explanation: Virtual machines must be placed in a resource group, which is a logical container for Azure resources.

text: In the infrastructure as a service (IaaS) cloud service model, which two components are the responsibility of the cloud service provider? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.

options.label: A
options.text: the configuration and maintenance of storage

options.label: B
options.text: the installation and configuration of the operating system

options.label: E
options.text: physical security of the datacenter infrastructure

explanation: In IaaS, the cloud provider is responsible for maintaining hardware and physical datacenter security.

text: You have a web app that runs in Azure. You need to identify the amount of time it takes for web pages to load in a user's browser. What should you use?
explanation: Application Insights provides browser page load time metrics and end-user experience monitoring.

text: Which two features of services can be integrated with Azure Monitor? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
note: Each correct answer is worth one point.
explanation: Application Insights and Log Analytics are core components integrated with Azure Monitor.

text: You need to start Azure Cloud Shell. What should you use?
explanation: Azure Cloud Shell is accessed through the Azure portal via a web browser.

text: You have an Azure subscription. You need to use Azure Cloud Shell to run a deployment script. What should you use to access Cloud Shell?
explanation: Azure Cloud Shell is a browser-based shell accessible through any web browser.

text: What provides a unified way to project and manage non-Azure resources in Azure Resource Manager (ARM)?
explanation: Azure Arc extends Azure management to on-premises and multi-cloud resources.

text: In the software as a service (SaaS) cloud service, which responsibility is shared between Microsoft and the customer?
explanation: In SaaS, information and data management is shared - Microsoft provides the platform, customers manage their data.

text: Your company has an Azure subscription and three business units. You need to ensure that the new resources are deployed by using a repeatable and reliable method that applies the same configurations to each resource. What should you use?
explanation: ARM templates enable infrastructure as code for consistent, repeatable deployments.

text: Which cloud computing benefit provides continuous user access to a cloud-based application with minimal downtime?
explanation: High availability ensures minimal downtime through redundancy and failover.

text: What should a desktop application use to interact with Azure and manage resources?
explanation: Desktop applications use Azure REST APIs for programmatic interaction with Azure services.

text: Which Azure service is an example of serverless computing?
explanation: Azure Functions provides serverless, event-driven compute without infrastructure management.

text: You need to migrate an on-premises server by using a lift-and-shift migration. To which type of cloud service should you migrate?
explanation: Lift-and-shift migrations move existing applications to IaaS VMs with minimal changes.

text: Which two features or services can be integrated with Azure Monitor? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
note: Each correct answer is worth one point.
explanation: Application Insights and Log Analytics are integrated monitoring components of Azure Monitor.

text: You have a set of Azure policies. You need to group related policies together. What should you use?
explanation: Policy initiatives group related policies for simplified assignment and management.

text: What can you use to make recommendations that will reduce Azure costs?
explanation: Azure Advisor analyzes configurations and usage to provide cost optimization recommendations.

text: Microsoft 365 is an example of which cloud service model?
explanation: Microsoft 365 provides complete software applications delivered as a service.

text: What is the function of a Site-to-Site VPN?

options.label: A
options.text: provides a secure connection between a computer on a public network and the corporate network

options.label: B
options.text: provides a connection from an on-premises VPN device to an Azure VPN gateway

options.label: C
options.text: provides a dedicated private connection to Azure that does NOT travel over the internet

explanation: Site-to-Site VPN creates an encrypted tunnel from on-premises VPN devices to Azure VPN Gateway.

text: What should you use to track the costs of Azure resources?
explanation: Azure budgets help track and manage costs with alerts when spending thresholds are reached.

text: You plan to collect and analyze event details for five Azure virtual machines. You need to run queries to compare the event details collected from all the virtual machines. Which two tools should you use?
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.
explanation: Azure Monitor collects the data and Log Analytics provides the query interface to analyze events across VMs.

text: You need to compare a company's cloud usage to industry standard best practices. What should you use?
explanation: Azure Advisor compares your configuration against best practices and provides recommendations.

text: Your company has an Azure subscription that contains several resources. You need to identify which department is responsible for the cost of each resource. What should you use?
explanation: Tags allow you to categorize resources by department for cost tracking and reporting.

text: Which service can replace a resource lock automatically if the lock is removed?
explanation: Azure Blueprints can enforce and automatically reapply resource locks as part of governance.

text: What is used to grant permission to Azure Virtual Desktop resources?
explanation: RBAC roles control access and permissions to Azure Virtual Desktop resources.

text: You have an Azure subscription. You need to review your secure score. What should you use?
explanation: Microsoft Defender for Cloud provides the secure score feature to assess security posture.

text: What is an example of vertical scaling in a cloud environment?

options.label: A
options.text: adding additional CPU to an existing Azure virtual machine

options.label: B
options.text: adding an additional Azure App Service instance automatically

options.label: C
options.text: adding an additional Azure virtual machine

options.label: D
options.text: adding an additional Azure Virtual Desktop session host

explanation: Vertical scaling (scaling up) adds more power to existing resources, like adding CPU or RAM.

text: What enables a cloud service to adapt quickly to changing requirements?
explanation: Agility enables rapid resource deployment and configuration changes to meet evolving needs.

text: Which service provides network traffic filtering across multiple Azure subscriptions and virtual networks?
explanation: Azure Firewall can protect resources across multiple subscriptions and virtual networks from a centralized location.

text: A company is planning on deploying a stateless based application based on microservices using the Azure Service Fabric service. Which of the following should you consider?

options.label: B
options.text: The number of node types in the cluster

options.label: C
options.text: The properties for each node type

explanation: For Azure Service Fabric infrastructure design, you need to consider the number of node types and their properties.

text: What should you use to evaluate whether your company's Azure environment meets regulatory requirements?
explanation: Microsoft Defender for Cloud includes a regulatory compliance dashboard to assess compliance posture.

text: You have an Azure virtual machine named VM1. You plan to encrypt VM1 by using Azure Disk Encryption. Which Azure resource must you create first?
explanation: Azure Disk Encryption requires an Azure Key Vault to store encryption keys.

text: What can you use to identify underutilized or unused Azure virtual machines?
explanation: Azure Advisor provides recommendations for underutilized resources to optimize costs.

text: You have a set of Azure policies. You need to group related policies together. What should you use?
explanation: Initiatives are collections of policy definitions grouped together.

text: What can you use to make recommendations that will reduce Azure costs?
explanation: Azure Advisor provides cost optimization recommendations based on usage patterns.

text: Microsoft 365 is an example of which cloud service model?
explanation: Microsoft 365 is a complete software solution delivered as a service.

text: What is the function of a Site-to-Site VPN?

options.label: A
options.text: provides a secure connection between a computer on a public network and the corporate network

options.label: B
options.text: provides a connection from an on-premises VPN device to an Azure VPN gateway

options.label: C
options.text: provides a dedicated private connection to Azure that does NOT travel over the internet

explanation: Site-to-Site VPN connects entire on-premises networks to Azure through VPN devices.

text: You plan to provision Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) resources in Azure. Which resource is an example of IaaS?
explanation: Azure virtual machines are IaaS resources where you manage the OS and applications.

text: Which service provides serverless computing in Azure?
explanation: Azure Functions provides serverless compute for event-driven code execution.

text: Who can use the Azure Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) calculator?

options.label: A
options.text: owners for an Azure subscription only

options.label: B
options.text: all users who have an account in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) that is linked to an Azure subscription only

options.label: D
options.text: billing readers for an Azure subscription only

explanation: The Azure TCO calculator is publicly available and can be used by anyone without an Azure subscription.

text: You have an accounting application named App1 that uses a legacy database. You plan to move App1 to the cloud. Which service model should you use?
explanation: Legacy applications with specific database requirements are best suited for IaaS where you have full control over the environment.

text: What is the longest term you can purchase for Azure Reserved VM Instances?
explanation: Azure Reserved VM Instances can be purchased for one-year or three-year terms.

text: You need to manage containers. Which two services can you use?
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.
explanation: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and Azure Container Instances are both container management services.

text: You have an Azure environment that contains 10 virtual networks and 100 virtual machines. You need to limit the inbound traffic to all the Azure virtual networks. What should you create?
explanation: A single Azure Firewall can protect multiple virtual networks centrally.

text: How should you calculate the composite SLA for an application that uses Azure services?
explanation: Composite SLA is calculated by multiplying the SLAs of all dependent services.

text: Which Service Level Agreement (SLA) is provided for Azure services in public preview?

options.label: A
options.text: Each service defines its own SLA.

options.label: C
options.text: The SLA will be 1% less than the general availability (GA) SLA.

explanation: Preview services typically have no SLA or each service defines its own terms, but they're generally excluded from standard SLAs.

text: What does a customer provide in a software as a service (SaaS) model?
explanation: In SaaS, customers provide their application data while the provider manages everything else.

text: You have 50 virtual machines hosted on-premises and 50 virtual machines hosted in Azure. The on-premises virtual machines and the Azure virtual machines connect to each other. Which type of cloud model is this?
explanation: A hybrid cloud combines on-premises infrastructure with public cloud resources.

text: You plan to deploy several Azure virtual machines. You need to ensure that the services running on the virtual machines remain available if a single data center fails. What are two possible solutions?
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.

options.label: A
options.text: Deploy the virtual machines to a scale set.

options.label: B
options.text: Deploy the virtual machines to two or more resource groups.

options.label: C
options.text: Deploy the virtual machines to two or more availability zones.

options.label: D
options.text: Deploy the virtual machines to two or more regions.

explanation: Availability zones and multiple regions both protect against datacenter failures.

text: You need to collect and automatically analyze security events from Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). What should you use?
explanation: Azure Sentinel is a SIEM solution that can collect and analyze security events from Azure AD.

text: What is the most severe failure from which an Azure Availability Zone can be used to protect access to Azure services?
explanation: Availability zones protect against datacenter-level failures within a region.

text: You need to purchase a third-party virtual security appliance that you will deploy to an Azure subscription. What should you use?
explanation: Azure Marketplace provides third-party solutions including virtual security appliances.

text: What are two benefits of cloud computing? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.

options.label: A
options.text: enables the rapid provisioning of resources

options.label: C
options.text: has the same configuration options as on-premises

options.label: D
options.text: shifts capital expenditures (CAPEX) to operating expenditures (OPEX)

explanation: Cloud computing enables rapid provisioning and shifts from CapEx to OpEx spending models.

text: Which cloud computing model includes on-premises and cloud-based resources?
explanation: Hybrid cloud combines on-premises infrastructure with public cloud services.

text: Where does Azure Monitor store performance data?
explanation: Azure Monitor stores performance data in Log Analytics workspaces for querying and analysis.

text: What should you use to prevent traffic from an Azure virtual network from being routed to an Azure Storage account via the internet?
explanation: Service endpoints enable private connectivity from virtual networks to Azure services without internet routing.

text: Which statement accurately describes the Modern Lifecycle Policy for Azure services?

options.label: A
options.text: Microsoft provides mainstream support for a service for five years.

options.label: B
options.text: Microsoft provides a minimum of 12 months notice before ending support for a service.

options.label: C
options.text: After a service is made generally available, Microsoft provides support for the service for a minimum of four years.

options.label: D
options.text: When a service is retired, you can purchase extended support for the service for up to five years.

explanation: The Modern Lifecycle Policy requires Microsoft to give at least 12 months' notice before ending support.

text: Which term represents the ability to increase the computing capacity of a virtual machine by adding memory or CPUs?
explanation: Vertical scaling means increasing the power of existing resources by adding CPU, memory, or other capabilities.

text: To which cloud models can you deploy physical servers?

options.label: A
options.text: private cloud and hybrid cloud only

options.label: C
options.text: private cloud, hybrid cloud and public cloud

explanation: Physical servers can be deployed in private cloud (on-premises) and hybrid cloud (combination of on-premises and cloud).

text: In which type of cloud model are all the hardware resources owned by a third-party and shared between multiple tenants?
explanation: In public cloud, the provider owns the hardware and shares it among multiple customers (multi-tenancy).

text: What can you use to automatically send an alert if an administrator stops an Azure virtual machine?
explanation: Azure Monitor can create alerts based on activity logs, including VM stop operations.

text: You have an Azure environment. You need to create a new Azure virtual machine from a tablet that runs the Android operating system. What are three possible solutions?
note: Each correct selection is worth one point.

options.label: A
options.text: Use Bash in Azure Cloud Shell.

options.label: B
options.text: Use PowerShell in Azure Cloud Shell.

options.label: D
options.text: Use the Security & Compliance admin center.

explanation: Android tablets can access Azure portal via browser and use both Bash and PowerShell in Cloud Shell.

text: You plan to deploy several Azure virtual machines. You need to ensure that the services running on the virtual machines are available if a single data center fails. Solution: You deploy the virtual machines to a scale set. Does this meet the goal?
explanation: A scale set alone doesn't guarantee datacenter failure protection. You need availability zones or regions.

text: Your company is planning a deployment using Azure Database for PostgreSQL. You need to select the appropriate deployment and pricing tier. What should you select?

options.label: A
options.text: Azure Database for PostgreSQL Single Server Memory Optimized tier

options.label: C
options.text: Azure Database for PostgreSQL Single Server General Purpose tier

options.label: D
options.text: Azure Database for PostgreSQL Single Server Basic tier

explanation: General Purpose tier supports up to 10 TB storage, Azure Premium Storage, and point-in-time restore up to 35 days while minimizing costs compared to Memory Optimized.

text: Your company uses management groups to manage resources in your Azure tenant more efficiently. User1 should be able to assign access and assign policies to management groups. You need to determine to which role-based access control (RBAC) role User1 should be added. What should you recommend?
explanation: User Access Administrator role allows managing access (role assignments) and policies on management groups following the principle of least privilege.
